label: Pinterest POWER! Discover this HOT social network.
description: This Pinterest Tutorial course aims to demystify Pinterest and all of its features. Pinterest has become one of the MOST POWERFUL social platforms on the internet today. Utilizing it in the right way will allow people and businesses to create an interested following in a SHORT amount of time. At the beginning, the basic features are covered including how to set up a new account on the network followed by a FULL WALK-THROUGH showing more advanced features such as CREATING A BOARD, HOW TO PIN, and WHY FOLLOWING IS IMPORTANT. At the end of this Pinterest Tutorial course, each learner will have the confidence, ability and knowledge to take their PINTEREST accounts and create the sort of network and INFLUENTIAL following they desire. Take this Pinterest Tutorial course and discover how to leverage this HOT Social Network!

label: How to Create a Social Network Site from Scratch
description: Show Details Hide Details With "How to Create s Social Network Site From Scratch", you will learn everything you need to create a social network site. This course it s structured in 6 chapters, more than 30 video lectures. The entire course it s based on an social network site example, inspired mainly on pinterest like site, that you ll learn to create from zero. I m a real fan of the learn-by-project method because it forces you to learn all the concepts applying them with something that you can use and re-use at the end. Why learn to create a social network site? The full course has more than 30 video lectures, divided into 6 chapters. Each chapter will give you a new level of knowledge in developing a social network site. We ll start from the basics with XHTML, CSS and Javascript to more advanced and the most popular/requested programming languages nowadays, such as ASP.NET 4.0, jSON, AJAX, jQuery, OOP, WebServices, the MS SQLServer database and the new HTML5+CSS3! The source code o

label: SharePoint 2010 Social Networking for End Users
description: In this course you will learn about some of SharePoint 2010 s social capabilities. SharePoint 2010 includes a site template for blogs where users and teams can easily publish simple content for others to read and comment on. It also includes a wiki site template which allows users to jointly collaborate on content such as in the case of a knowledge base. In this course you ll learn not only how to create both blogs and wikis in SharePoint 2010, but you ll also learn how to manage and use them effectively.

label: Social Network Engagement
description: Have you ever got "caught up in the hype". Well thats where you need to be in the hype, all the social networks will make your business move to victory. This course is designed to keep you engaged within a strong structure. We will teach you how to tweet when you while your sleeping or attending a meeting with out getting dirty looks. Google search can be your best friend or your worst enemy. In this course we will teach you how to get the most out of google through the masses. If social networks were a night club, Facebook would be the V.I.P, twitter would be the dance floor and pinterest would be the bar. In this course we will teach you how to work the entire club to your advantage. We also offer the opportunity to learn in a private one on one setting with out social networking guru. Get involved!

label: Social Network Analysis
description: Everything is connected: people, information, events and places, all the more so with the advent of online social media. A practical way of making sense of the tangle of connections is to analyze them as networks. In this course you will learn about the structure and evolution of networks, drawing on knowledge from disciplines as diverse as sociology, mathematics, computer science, economics, and physics. Online interactive demonstrations and hands-on analysis of real-world data sets will focus on a range of tasks: from identifying important nodes in the network, to detecting communities, to tracing information diffusion and opinion formation.

description: Best Practices refers to one or more sets of refined policies, procedures, processes, techniques, tools and methodologies that have been optimized for efficiency and effectiveness, and adopted within the organization.
